page.title: 04Leisure Time in Alford
page.content: There are clubs to suit all ages and interests. One of the oldest is the Vale of Alford Curling Club which was formed in 1874.Others are: pre-school play group, mothers and toddlers, guides, brownies, scouts, cubs, Sunday school, youth clubs, young farmers, badminton, bowling, canoeing, football, football supporters, golf, judo, pony club, swimming, tennis, women's guild, young wives, SWRI, floral art, ladies circle and round table, bridge club, computer club, women's league of health & beauty, lunch club, over sixties, and freemasons. These groups meet in Tullynessle school and hall, the church and public halls, hotels, Alford Academy and Community Centre as well as their own club rooms and grounds.
